description:
In the early twentieth century, Russo-Japanese War veteran Saichi “Immortal” Sugimoto scratches out a meager existence during the postwar gold rush in the wilderness of Hokkaido. When he stumbles across a map to a fortune in hidden Ainu gold, he sets off on a treacherous quest to find it. But Sugimoto is not the only interested party, and everyone who knows about the gold will kill to possess it! Faced with the harsh conditions of the northern wilderness, ruthless criminals and rogue Japanese soldiers, Sugimoto will need all his skills and luck—and the help of an Ainu girl named Asirpa—to survive.

(Source: Viz Media)

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Indigenous Cultures
tags.description: Prominently features real-life indigenous cultures.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Medicine
tags.description: Centered around the activities of people working in the field of medicine.

tags.name: Oiran
tags.description: Prominently features a courtesan character of the Japanese Edo Period.

node.description:
__Current Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Website](https://723000451898910026.weebly.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/satorunoda)

Satoru Noda  is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known as the creator of the manga series [Golden Kamuy](https://anilist.co/manga/86559/Golden-Kamuy/), for which he won the 2016 Manga Taishō and the Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize.

He used to be the assistant of [Yasuyuki Kunitomo](https://anilist.co/staff/114715/Yasuyuki-Kunitomo) and [Mitsurou Kubo](https://anilist.co/staff/96926/Mitsurou-Kubo).

node.description:
[Website](https://www.mwamjapan.info) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mwamofficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/MWAMofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mwamofficial/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/MWAMjapan)

__Introduction:__
Man with a Mission, stylized as MAN WITH A MISSION or sometimes as MWAM is a Japanese rock band which was formed in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan in 2010. This band currently consists five band members, with stage names of Tokyo Tanaka, Jean-Ken Johnny, Kamikaze Boy, DJ Santa Monica and Spear Rib.

MWAM's music style has been described as hard rock and dance rock. Their distinguishing feature is that all of the members wear differently designed wolf masks during both their concerts and their music videos. Many of their singles have been used as theme songs for a variety of anime, live-action movies, and video games.

__Biography:__
Before becoming popular, the band invented a back-story for why they wear wolf masks, which involves them being created as the "Ultimate Life Form" by [Jimi Hendrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimi_Hendrix), who is described by the band as being the doctor of the guitar and master wolf biologist. They were then frozen in Antarctica for years. While they were frozen, they had been listening to all kinds of music from all around the world, before later escaping and emerging onto the Japanese music scene.

The earliest debut of the band was in a number of live gigs at venues in the Shibuya area. The band organized an American tour in late 2010, which was called their "[Whisky a Go Go](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whisky_a_Go_Go)" tour and involved multiple gigs at night clubs in Los Angeles. The tour itself ended in November 2010. The end of their tour coincided with the release of their first mini album, ___Welcome to the New World___, in November as well, which went on to sell out in a number of stores across Japan. The mini album also spent six weeks on the [Oricon Top 100](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oricon) for number of sales. On April 29, 2011, they released a new single titled "Never Fxxkin' Mind the Rules". After the single release, the band started another music tour on March 7, 2011, called "Man with a Mission Japan Marking Tour 2011", which included 13 different performances across Japan. Their first full debut album, ___Man with a Mission___, released on June 8, 2011.

Soon after the release of their album, they participated in a major Japanese concert event, known as "[Summer Sonic 2011](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Sonic_Festival)" in mid-August, and also a number of other summer festivals, such as "Countdown Japan 11/12". Labeled by ___Eggman Magazine___ as the "Most Promising Newcomer", tickets to their show at the concert festival sold out within ten minutes. During the stream of concerts, their songs were also run on 27 of the major FM and AM radio broadcasting stations nationwide across Japan. On October 5, 2011, the band released an EP titled ___Trick or Treat___, which included a number of original songs and also cover songs, such as "[Smells Like Teen Spirit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smells_Like_Teen_Spirit)" by [Nirvana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_(band)). The members of Man with a Mission were also featured in a poster campaign by [Tower Records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tower_Records) titled "___No Music, No Life?___", which began on September 13, 2011.

Continuation of biography here: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_with_a_Mission)

___Members:___
- Tokyo Tanaka (トーキョー・タナカ) - vocals, leader
- [Jean-Ken Johnny](https://anilist.co/staff/149135/JeanKen-Johnny) (ジャン・ケン・ジョニー) - guitar, vocals, rap
- [Kamikaze Boy](https://anilist.co/staff/149139/Kamikaze-Boy) (カミカゼ・ボーイ) - bass guitar, backing vocals
- DJ Santa Monica (DJサンタモニカ) - DJ, sampling
- Spear Rib (スペア・リブ) - drums

(Sources: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_with_a_Mission) | [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAN_WITH_A_MISSION) | [mwamjapan.info](https://www.mwamjapan.info/profiles))

[Website](https://thesixthlie.jp)

The Sixth Lie is a Japanese electronic rock band formed in May 2015 in Tokyo, Japan. Their music is known for its hybrid style inspired by the latest western music, and their overall science fiction-inspired theme connected to near future and outer space.

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/216048/)._

[Official Website](https://kaikigadou.kilo.jp/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/26720820) l [Blog](https://smys0201.blog.fc2.com/)
Born in Tohoku, grew up in Kanto, currently resides in Nara.

After graduating from Game Graphic College in 2007, she got a job with Capcom Co., Ltd., where she was responsible mainly for modelling as a 3D modeler. Went freelance in 2015. Currently drawing illustrations and manga, mainly for solo and group exhibitions.

It was confirmed during her presence at a book fair in France (Fête du livre du Var) and with the pronouns used in the French edition of Jinba that Sumiyoshi is a woman, contrary to assumptions that were made based on her profile picture.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayama11)

Married to [Atsuko Ueno](https://anilist.co/staff/216671/).

Older brother of [Kenji Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/105419/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayama11)

Married to [Atsuko Ueno](https://anilist.co/staff/216671/).

Older brother of [Kenji Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/105419/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayama11)

Married to [Atsuko Ueno](https://anilist.co/staff/216671/).
